required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Use of Laser in the Treatment of Atrophic Vulvovaginitis
clinical_study.official_title: The Use of Laser in the Treatment of Atrophic Vulvovaginitis and Its Consequent Improvement in Sexual Satisfaction

brief_summary.textblock: This study evaluates the efficacy and security of laser for atrophy treatment. Half of participants will receive the laser treatment and the other half placebo.

detailed_description.textblock: Thermal laser treatments are proposed as the newest treatments for atrophy. Through the thermal effect it would stimulates de mucosa, enhances the collagen component and the vascularization. Collagen remodeling and new collagen synthesis has been suggested as a mechanism of laser induced skin resurfacing and remodeling of vaginal connective tissue.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Double blind, randomized, control clinical trial
study_design_info.masking_description: The patient and the outcomes assessor and principal investigator has not access to the randomization system

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Female Sexual Function Index questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: Female Sexual Function Index is a self- administered questionnaire that evaluate 19 items about sexual life. Minimum score is 2, and the highest is 36. Higher score mean a better outcome

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline in Female Sexual Function Index questionnaire
primary_outcome.description: Female Sexual Function Index is a self- administered questionnaire that evaluate 19 items about sexual life. Minimum score is 2, and the highest is 36. Higher score mean a better outcome

Vagina cytology will be obtain to evaluate initial conditions of the vagina and modifications after treatment. Papanicolaou coloration and the count of superficial, intermediate, parabasal and basal cells will be applied to measure improvement of vaginal atrophy

the normal vaginal acidity is between 3,8 a 4,5. In postmenopausal women is higher. We are going to evaluate the improvement in vaginal acidity to normal values of premenopausal women. It will be evaluate with specific acidity measurement strips (this strips measures between 3.8 y 5.4)

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patient with Local Estrogen therapy requirement post intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Number of patients that Need estrogen replacement for atrophy vulvovaginal symptoms, despite the intervention.This will be evaluate with a Yes/No question.

other_outcome.measure: Number of participant with Adverse events reported in each visit
other_outcome.description: It will be evaluate the number of patients that reported adverse events such as dyspareunia, irritation, edema, vaginal dryness, genital bleeding, vaginal discharge, pain, lesions

arm_group.description: Laser diiodo treatment, 3 procedures of 5-10 minutes at intervals of 4 weeks
Only the laser speculum is placed in the vagina but the laser is not activated. 3 procedures of 5-10 minutes at intervals of 4 weeks

intervention.description: 3 laser diiodo procedures of 5-10 minutes at intervals of 4 weeks It is an outpatient procedure, not anesthesia required.
3 laser diiodo procedures of 5-10 minutes at intervals of 4 weeks. It is an outpatient procedure, not anesthesia required.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Menopause women with vulvovaginal symptoms of atrophy
- No previous estrogen treatment for the last 30 days
- Active sexual life (vaginal penetration)
- Accept to participate
- Pap atrophy or hypotrophy in the last year
Exclusion Criteria:
- Vulvovaginal diseases
- Abnormal uterine bleeding
- Antidepressants drugs
- Uncontrolled diabetes
- Cervical intraepithelial lesions or cancer
- Photosensitized or under treatment with photosensibilized drugs
- Collagen diseases
- Vulvovaginal infections in the last 15 days
- Immunosuppressed patients or under immunosuppressed treatments

reference.citation: Knight C, Logan V, Fenlon D. A systematic review of laser therapy for vulvovaginal atrophy/genitourinary syndrome of menopause in breast cancer survivors. Ecancermedicalscience. 2019 Dec 12;13:988. doi: 10.3332/ecancer.2019.988. eCollection 2019.

results_reference.citation: Adabi K, Golshahi F, Niroomansh S, Razzaghi Z, Ghaemi M. Effect of the Fractional CO(2) Laser on the Quality of Life, General Health, and Genitourinary Symptoms in Postmenopausal Women With Vaginal Atrophy: A Prospective Cohort. J Lasers Med Sci. 2020 Winter;11(1):65-69. doi: 10.15171/jlms.2020.11. Epub 2020 Jan 18.
